title: Fortnite down as 4.2 million watch The End and wait for Fortnite 2
text:
Fortnite – this is the end, beautiful friend

The nightmare of every fan has come true: Fortnite has been switched off by Epic Games and you can’t currently play it… but for how long?

Just as was promised, Fortnite has come to an end, with the close of Season X enjoying the normal end of season party, but after that everything really did switch off.

The live event was streamed on Twitch and with 4.2 million people tuning in it all but broke it. But add in YouTube, Mixer, and other sources and the event had an estimated global audience of over 7 million – even though no-one is entirely sure what’s going to happen afterwards.

As of Sunday evening, you can’t get into the game and the only thing you can see in the livestream is a picture of the black hole that sucked in everything at the end of the event.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Obviously Fortnite isn’t really over, even if the original map that has been in use, in one way or another, for the last two years seems to be gone forever.

For months now there has been rumours about a new map and on Friday a leaked bit of promo art seemed to show exactly that, with what will likely be called Fortnite: Chapter 2 in English.

The promo art is very low resolution but shows a map that still features some recognisable landmarks, such as Tilted Towers, but also new features such as a river and boats.

Even with that leak though nobody knows when the game will be back and playable, and it could be several hours yet.

Whatever Epic have done to their servers it’s even caused the Epic Games Store to go down, even if you’ve never even played Fortnite on the PC.

However, if you really don’t want to stop playing you can input the famous Konami code (↑↑↓↓←→←→BA) into the game as it is now and play a little 2D shooting game while you wait.
